Package uwallet

Class Wallet

  • java.lang.Object
    • uwallet.Wallet
  • public class Wallet
extends java.lang.Object
    RI: No two wallet can EVER be created with the same UID unless first ensures both the persistent data stores are clear of references to the UID. A single wallet can only be used for a single geographic region. No two accounts belonging to this wallet can have identical names. AF: Wallet object holds multiple accounts of the same currency. It tracks these accounts in a hashMap that maps the name of an account under this wallet to it's unique identifier (which is created by the wallet) to load account objects. methods interact with the accounts in the wallet through the account name that was given to the account - of course this means no two account can have identical names.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Wallet​(java.lang.String walletUID, java.lang.String regionCode)
      Creates a new wallet with the given UID and adds reference to it in the persistent storage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wallet

        public Wallet​(java.lang.String walletUID,
              java.lang.String regionCode)
       throws UniqueIDConstraintException
        Creates a new wallet with the given UID and adds reference to it in the persistent storage.
        Parameters:
        walletUID - - globally unique string to identify this wallet. Can not be null or empty.
        regionCode - ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code for the country whose currency is desired
        Throws:
        UniqueIDConstraintException - if another wallet object with the same uniqueIdentifier already exists either in DB.

      • loadWallet

                         throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException

      • createNewAccount

        public void createNewAccount​(java.lang.String accountName)
                      throws UniqueIDConstraintException
        Adds a new account to this wallet.
        Parameters:
        accountName - - String representing the name to be given to this account. Empty or Null strings are not allowed
        Throws:
        UniqueIDConstraintException - if this wallet already has an account with the desired name.

      • getAccountBalanceFormatted

        public java.lang.String getAccountBalanceFormatted​(java.lang.String accountName)
                                            throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        returns the formatted account balance for account with the given name.
        Parameters:
        accountName - - String the name of the account whose balance we want
        Returns:
        the formatted account balance using the region code for this wallet.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if no such account in this wallet have the given name

                                                 throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        returns the formatted account balance for account with the given name.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the account balance as a BigDecimal.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if no such account in this wallet have the given name

      • depositToAccount

        public void depositToAccount​(double amount,
                             java.lang.String accountName,
                             java.lang.String... description)
                      throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        deposits an amount of money to the account with the given name.
        Parameters:
        amount - - double the amount to be deposited to the account
        accountName - - String the name of the account to deposit money to
        description - String (optional). description[0] is a String of at most 50char that is not null. All other items in description are ignored. The default description is N/A. Should not be an empty string.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if the accountName does not represent an account that is held by this wallet.

      • withdrawFromAccount

        public void withdrawFromAccount​(double amount,
                                java.lang.String accountName,
                                java.lang.String... description)
                         throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException,
                                InsufficientFundsException
        withdraws an amount of money from the account with the given name.
        Parameters:
        amount - - double the amount to be withdrawn from the account
        accountName - - String the name of the account to deposit money to
        description - String (optional). description[0] is a String of at most 50char that is not null. All other items in description are ignored. The default description is N/A. Should not be an empty string.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if the accountName does not represent an account that is held by this wallet.
        InsufficientFundsException - if the account does not have sufficient funds for the withdrawal.

      • transfer

        public void transfer​(double amount,
                     java.lang.String fromAccountName,
                     java.lang.String toAccountName,
                     java.lang.String... description)
              throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException,
                     InsufficientFundsException
        transfers the given amount from one account to another
        Parameters:
        amount - - double the amount to be transferred between the two accounts
        fromAccountName - - String the name of the account to withdraw money from
        toAccountName - - String the name of the account to deposit the money to
        description - String (optional). description[0] is a String of at most 50char that is not null. All other items in description are ignored. The default description is N/A. Should not be an empty string.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if one of the two account name do not refer to a valid account for this wallet
        InsufficientFundsException - if the fromAccount does not have sufficient funds for the withdrawal.

      • getLastNTransactions

        public java.util.List<Transaction> getLastNTransactions​(java.lang.String accountName,
                                                        int N)
                                                 throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        Parameters:
        accountName - - String the account whose transaction history we want to access
        N - - the number of records to return.
        Returns:
        a list of length 0-N (limited by the total number of transactions for the account) of the last 0-N transactions that are on file for this account. The list is made of Transaction objects
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if one of the two account name do not refer to a valid account for this wallet

      • getAccount

        public uwallet.Account getAccount​(java.lang.String accountName)
                           throws NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException
        Parameters:
        accountName - - String the account whose transaction history we want to access
        Returns:
        the Account object for the given account name.
        Throws:
        NoSuchObjectInDatabaseException - if one of the two account name do not refer to a valid account for this wallet

      • deleteAllRecord

        public static void deleteAllRecord​(java.lang.String password)
        erases all data, for all wallets. WARNING THIS IS IRREVERSIBLE
        Parameters:
        password - - String must be 'delete' for method to work, just to make it a bit harder for this method to be called accidentally.

      • getUID

        public java.lang.String getUID()
        Returns:
        the UID for this wallet

      • getRegionCode

        public java.lang.String getRegionCode()
        Returns:
        ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or UN M.49 numeric-3 area code for the country whose currency is used in this wallet.
